荷兰 四十二 43 +1
奥地利 52 四十二 –10
法国 58 三十七 –21
越南 53 三十 –23
捷克共和国 22 20 –2
日本 17 16 –1

插曲：关于感恩与愧疚

INTERLUDE: ON GRATITUDE AND FEELINGS OF GUILT

我们应该感恩吗？如果应该，那么应该感恩谁或感恩什么？

Should we feel thankful? If so, then to whom or to what?

对帮过你的朋友、安慰你的同伴或危难时挺身而出的朋友心存感激是健康而明智的。我们也可以而且应该为自己的健康、所爱之人身体健康甚至自己还活着这一基本事实而心存感激。

It is healthy and sensible to feel gratitude to a friend who does you a favor, to a companion who consoles you, or to a friend who stands up for you in a time of crisis. We also can and should be thankful for being healthy, for the fact that the people we love are in good shape, and even for the basic fact that we are alive.

然而，还有另一种感恩，一种被迫的、非自然的感恩——宗教要求的感恩。我说的是感恩神。

There is, however, another type of thankfulness, a forced and unnatural thankfulness—the thankfulness that is demanded by religion. I am talking about being thankful to a god.

当我们开始对一个外在的力量、一个无所不能的存在心存感激时，事情就变得棘手了。这种感激变成了一种偶然的感激，其本质就是假定这个存在本可以选择让其他事情发生——更糟糕的事情。

When we start to feel gratitude toward an external power, an omnipotent being, things become problematic. It becomes a contingent thankfulness, which by its very nature assumes that this being could have chosen to let something else happen—something worse.

为什么我是唯一一个在事故中幸存下来的人，而其他人都没有这么好的运气？为什么我的身体很好，而我的许多朋友都身患重病？或者为什么我得了癌症，而我的许多朋友都安然无恙？

Why was I the only one who survived the accident, when no one else had that good luck? Why am I in good health, when so many of my friends are suffering from serious illnesses? Or why did I get hit by cancer when so many of my friends are fine?

一位牧师问一群六岁的孩子：“孩子们，今天你想感谢上帝什么？丽莎，你想感谢上帝什么？”

A priest asks a group of six-year-old children, “Children, what would you like to thank God for today? Lisa, what do you want to thank God for?”

“我要感谢上帝让我的父母感觉良好并且快乐，”丽莎说。

“I want to thank God for making my parents feel good and be happy,” says Lisa.

“萨姆，你想感谢上帝什么呢？”

“Sam, what do you want to thank God for?”

“我要感谢上帝保佑我妹妹身体健康。”

“I would like to thank God for keeping my sister healthy.”

也许这一切听起来无伤大雅。但是，小莉娜坐在那里，知道她的父母多么不开心，她会有什么感觉呢？他们可能很快就会离婚。或者她的父母之一病危。莉娜在想什么？

Perhaps this all sounds harmless. But how does Lena feel, little Lena who is sitting there knowing how deeply unhappy her parents are? They may soon be getting divorced. Or perhaps one of her parents is critically ill. What is Lena thinking?

“为什么上帝不希望我的父母幸福？为什么我的爸爸不能健康？我做了什么不值得上帝的关爱？为什么在上帝的眼里，我不算数？”

“Why doesn’t God want my parents to be happy? Why can’t my daddy be healthy? What did I do to not deserve God’s caring? Why do I not count, in God’s eyes?”

将一个人的感恩之心指向宇宙存在，无论我们称之为上帝还是其他我们赋予其意图、力量和影响他人的愿望的东西，似乎都是完全合理的，只要我们自己的生活中只发生积极的事情，只要我们不担心别人的生活。

To direct one’s thankfulness toward a cosmic being, whether we call it God or something else to which we attribute intentions, powers, and the desire to affect people, might seem perfectly reasonable, so long as only positive things happen in our own little lives, and so long as we aren’t worried about other people’s lives.

但生活并非如此。当我们突然遭遇逆境时，我们之前对上天的感激之情可能会瞬间变成羞愧或内疚，甚至是背叛或仇恨的感觉。

But that’s not how life really is. When we are suddenly hit by adversity, our prior feelings of thankfulness toward a higher power can in a flash turn into feelings of shame or guilt, or even feelings of betrayal or hatred.

我们不应该教孩子在神灵面前感到羞耻或内疚。出于同样的原因，我们也不应该教孩子对神灵心存感激。更人性化的感激之情在于谦卑地承认好事发生在我们身上，并意识到我们很容易遭遇不幸。它在于感谢我们的健康，感谢我们在生活中有幸遇到的好事，感谢我们与所爱之人的深厚感情。

We should not teach children to feel shame or guilt before a divine being. And for this same reason, we should not teach children to feel thankfulness toward a god. A more human form of thankfulness resides in humbly recognizing the fact that good things have happened to us and in being aware that we could easily have been hit by misfortunes instead. It resides in being thankful for our health, for the good things that we’ve had the luck to encounter in life, and for the deep bonds we have with our loved ones.

最好避免对神秘的超自然力量产生感激之情，但我们当然应该对生活中的美好事物培养一种无限的、无方向的感激之情，而不要让超自然力量参与其中的信念污染它。

It’s best to avoid feelings of gratitude to mysterious unearthly powers, but we should certainly cultivate an indefinite, undirected sense of gratitude for what’s good in life, without contaminating it with a belief that supernatural powers were involved therein.

第十四章

CHAPTER FOURTEEN

我们应该教导孩子什么？关于信仰、科学以及学校如何谈论生活

WHAT SHOULD WE TEACH OUR CHILDREN? Concerning Faith, Science, and How Schools Talk about Life

如果政府当局认为学校向孩子们传授上帝是最高权威是有用的，那他们就太自欺欺人了。如今，你甚至无法让学童相信这种胡说八道。——Hjalmar Söderberg（瑞典最伟大的作家之一），《Hjärtats oro》（1909 年）

Governmental authorities are fooling themselves very badly if they think that it is useful for schools to teach children that God is the ultimate authority. Today you can’t even get schoolchildren to believe in such rubbish.—Hjalmar Söderberg (one of Sweden’s greatest authors), Hjärtats oro (1909)

我如果我们真想看到启蒙运动的新曙光，就必须从我们的孩子开始。在一个狂热和迷信猖獗的世界里，学校在教导孩子们清晰思考和培养独立批判性思维方面发挥着前所未有的关键作用。教育是启蒙思维成长所需的营养。在世界许多地方，儿童——尤其是女孩——上学的机会非常有限。我们西方世界生活在享有特权的国家，在那里上学是理所当然的事情。

If we are ever going to see a new dawning of enlightenment, it will have to start with our children. In a world burgeoning with fanaticism and superstition, schools have an unprecedentedly crucial role to play in teaching children the art of clear thinking and of developing an independent style of critical thought. Education is the nourishment that enlightened thinking needs in order to grow. In many parts of the world, children—especially girls—have very limited opportunities to go to school. We in the Western world live in privileged countries where going to school is taken for granted.

但光上学是不够的。学校里教授的内容也必须达到标准。就存在主义和科学问题而言，瑞典教育存在严重缺陷，与几乎所有西方国家的情况相似。

But going to school is not enough. The content taught in schools also has to be up to snuff. As far as existential and scientific questions are concerned, there are serious lacks in Swedish education, and they are similar to those in almost all Western lands.

当我们谈论孩子时，我们倾向于从外部角度对他们进行分类，而我们永远不会用这种方式来对待政治意识形态之类的东西。我们不假思索地就随意地谈论穆斯林、基督教和犹太儿童——但事实上，没有穆斯林、基督教或犹太儿童；只有穆斯林、基督教或犹太父母的孩子。我们永远不会把六岁的丽莎形容为“民主党”小女孩，也不会把七岁的卡尔形容为“共和党”小男孩。我们只会说丽莎和卡尔的父母是民主党人或共和党人。在我看来，我们应该学会把孩子看作生来没有任何宗教信仰的个体。

When we speak about children, we tend to categorize them from an external point of view in a manner that we would never do with something like political ideologies. Without any careful reflection, we casually speak of Muslim, Christian, and Jewish children—but in fact, there are no Muslim, Christian, or Jewish children; there are only children with Muslim, Christian, or Jewish parents. We would never describe six-year-old Lisa as a “Democratic” little girl, or seven-year-old Carl as a “Republican” little boy. We would simply say that Lisa and Carl have parents who are Democrats or Republicans. In my opinion, we should learn to see children as individuals who are born without any kind of religious faith.

让孩子们发现真实的世界

Let Children Discover the World as It truly Is

在瑞典，孩子们必须接受至少九年的学校教育，很快可能会达到十年甚至更长。因此，一个根本问题是我们应该教给孩子们什么——更具体地说，应该根据哪些基本原则来决定所教授的主题和思想。国家有责任确保每个孩子都能理性地看待世界。因此，学校不应该教孩子们信仰某种特定的宗教，而应该教授人类发现的关于世界及其形成方式的科学事实。根据联合国《儿童权利公约》，所有儿童都有宗教自由权：“缔约国应尊重儿童思想、良心和宗教自由的权利。” 1

In Sweden, children are required to go to school for at least nine years, and soon it may be ten or even more. A fundamental question is therefore what we should teach our children—more specifically, what underlying principles should determine the topics and ideas that are taught. It’s the state’s duty to make sure that every child receives a rational outlook on the world. Schools should thus not teach children to believe in one particular religion but, instead, should teach the scientific facts that humanity has discovered about the world and how it is made. According to the United Nations convention on children’s rights, all children have this right to the freedom of religion: “States Parties shall respect the right of the child to freedom of thought, conscience and religion.”1

因此，我们认为学校教授神创论、地狱之火和诅咒理论或其他宗教观念是不可接受的。所有教学都应远离宗教。当然，学校可以教授宗教人生哲学，但不应传播宗教人生哲学。这一原则应适用于义务教育阶段和高等教育阶段。

Accordingly, we should consider it unacceptable for a school to teach creationism, theories of hellfire and damnation, or other religious notions. All teachings should be religion free. Of course a school can teach about religious philosophies of life, but it should not transmit one. This principle should hold both for the mandatory period of schooling and at higher levels of education.

奇怪的是，美国是世界上仅有的两个尚未批准《联合国儿童权利公约》的国家之一（另一个是索马里）。1995 年，克林顿总统签署了该公约，但敌对的压力团体游说美国参议院不要批准该公约。这些团体认为，通过该协议将允许儿童选择自己的宗教信仰而不是父母的宗教信仰，并允许儿童抗议和合法反对父母的决定。这些团体还担心，批准该公约将迫使美国在儿童福利上花费比国防更多的钱。由于这种恐吓行为，即使过了二十多年，该公约仍未得到美国参议院的批准。

The strange fact is that the United States is one of only two countries in the world (the other being Somalia) that have not ratified the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. In 1995, President Clinton signed the convention, but antagonistic pressure groups lobbied on the U.S. Senate not to ratify it. These groups argued that adopting the agreement would allow children to choose their own religion instead of their parents’ and would allow children to protest and to legally oppose parental decisions. Such groups were also fearful that ratification of the convention would coerce the United States to spend more on children’s welfare than on national defense. As a result of such fear-mongering, the convention still remains unratified by the U.S. Senate, even after more than twenty years.

儿童是脆弱的。他们既缺乏智力，也缺乏情感工具，无法弄清楚自己相对于成人世界中令人困惑的喧嚣所处的位置。因此，至关重要的是，教室应该是一个中立的空间，使用中立、客观的方法来探索和分析现实。学校还应该提供一套基本的价值观体系，例如瑞典议会通过的法律。这意味着他们应该传达一种基本的民主观点，强调所有人的平等权利，无论他们的肤色如何肤色、性别、性取向、人生观或民族。任何宗教的道德或伦理观点都不应受到偏袒。

Children are vulnerable. They possess neither the intellectual nor the emotional tools to be able to figure out where they themselves stand relative to the confusing clamor of voices in the adult world. For this reason, it is crucial that a schoolroom should be a neutral space where neutral, objective methods are used to explore and analyze reality. Schools should also provide an underlying system of values such as the one voted into law by Sweden’s Parliament. This means that they should convey a basic democratic viewpoint in which all people’s equal rights are stressed, regardless of their skin color, gender, sexual orientation, philosophy of life, or ethnicity. Nor should any religion’s viewpoint about morality or ethics be favored.

几年前，尼古拉斯·汉弗莱（Nicholas Humphrey，1943- ）是英国著名的心理学教授，他专注于智力发展和意识的本质，在牛津大学发表了一场引起争议的演讲。这次演讲由国际特赦组织安排，讨论宗教自由学校的问题。汉弗莱认为，父母应该有自由，但不能有任意大的自由，来决定他们的孩子。当然，今天的法律已经对父母按照自己的意愿抚养孩子的权利施加了某些限制。事实上，瑞典是世界上第一个禁止父母用手杖或鞭打孩子的国家（1979 年），今天大多数欧洲国家都效仿了这一做法。对儿童的性剥削也已被定为犯罪。

Some years ago, Nicholas Humphrey (1943– ), a noted British professor of psychology who focuses on the development of intelligence and the nature of consciousness, gave a controversial lecture at Oxford. The talk was arranged by Amnesty International and dealt with religious free schools. Humphrey argued that parents should have freedom, but not arbitrarily great freedom, to make choices concerning their children. Of course, today’s laws already place certain limitations on parents’ rights to bring up their children as they wish. In fact, Sweden was the first country in the world to prohibit caning or whipping of children by their parents (1979), and today most European countries have followed suit. Sexual exploitation of children has also been criminalized.

然而，汉弗莱的观点是，我们不仅要保护儿童免受身体攻击，还要保护他们免受心理攻击。我们不能让学校教孩子们天空中行星的位置控制着我们的生活，或者婚前性行为会下地狱受罚，或者女人应该服从男人，或者一个人有责任杀死与自己宗教信仰不同的人。学校也不应该教孩子们圣经是千真万确的，或者人类是六千年前上帝创造的。学校有责任为孩子们提供审视和理解世界所需的推理工具和分析工具。这是学校的主要职责。

Humphrey’s point, however, was that we have to protect children not just from physical acts of aggression but also from aggressions of a psychological nature. We cannot let schools teach children that the positions of planets in the sky control our lives, or that premarital sex is punished in hell, or that women should be subjugated to men, or that one has the duty to kill people whose religion is not one’s own. Nor should schools teach that the Bible is literally true, or that humanity was divinely created some six thousand years ago. Schools are responsible for giving children the reasoning tools and analytical tools that are needed to examine and understand our world. This is a school’s primary duty.

魔法和宗教观念有很强的代代相传的倾向。这可能是因为孩子在成长过程中深受父母观念的影响。与所有其他动物不同，人类的生存和进化得益于前几代人积累的知识的口头和书面传承。如果孩子依赖父母对世界及其危险的描述，他们生存的机会就会大得多。“不要捡地上的蛇！”“不要试图抚摸老虎！”“不要在有鳄鱼的河里游泳！”然而，年幼的孩子无法区分明智的建议（例如，“不要靠近那只老虎！”）和无用的建议（例如，“要想下雨，就在满月时献祭一只山羊”）。

Magical and religious notions have a strong tendency to survive down through the generations. This is probably a result of the fact that children grow up strongly imprinted with their parents’ ideas. Humans, in contrast to all other animals, survive and evolve thanks to the passing on, both orally and in writing, of knowledge accumulated by earlier generations. Children have a much greater chance of surviving if they depend on their parents’ description of the world and its dangers. “Don’t pick up a snake on the ground!” “Don’t try to pet a tiger!” “Don’t swim in a river where there are crocodiles!” Young children, however, cannot distinguish between wise advice (e.g., “Don’t go anywhere near that tiger!”) and useless advice (e.g., “To make rain fall, sacrifice a goat when the moon is full”).

不幸的是，孩子的信仰并不可靠，而且很容易被滥用。如果父母告诉孩子：“如果你不祈祷上帝，你就会下地狱”，那么孩子一生都可能受到伤害。

Unfortunately, a child’s placement of faith is unreliable, and it can be abused. A parent who tells their child, “You will wind up in hell unless you pray to God whenever you think unclean thoughts” is very likely to damage the child for the rest of the child’s life.

对于许多宗教团体和教派来说，不允许成员受到外界影响至关重要，因此，这些团体运作方式的一个主要特点就是防止成员与其他团体混在一起。任何批评该团体的团体成员都被认为是被魔鬼或撒旦附身。顺从团体被认为是一种美德，不问世事则被视为精神纯洁。当皈依者自己热衷于筑起高墙抵御外界思想时，灌输是最成功的。

For many religious groups and sects, it is crucial that members not be allowed to be influenced by outsiders, and for this reason, a central feature of the modus operandi of such groups is to prevent members from mixing with other groups. Any group member who criticizes the group is said to have been possessed by demons or by Satan. Being submissive to the group is considered to be a virtue, and not asking questions about the world is seen as spiritual purity. Indoctrination is the most successful when it’s the converts themselves who are gung-ho to build high walls against external thoughts.

幼年时期的灌输很难摆脱。因此，对儿童的心理攻击行为可能与身体攻击行为一样有害。这种行为可能是决定性的和不可逆转的。因此，在某些情况下，学校必须能够保护年幼的儿童和青少年免受父母的灌输和阻止他们与外界进行公开、双向接触的机会。

Indoctrination at an early age can be very hard to break away from. For that reason, psychological acts of aggression against children can be just as harmful as physical acts of aggression. Such acts can be definitive and irreversible. It is thus crucial, in certain cases, that schools be able to protect young children and teenagers from their parents—from indoctrination and from attempts to block children’s chances to have open, two-way contacts with the outside world.

瑞典的宗派学校

Sectarian Schools in Sweden

在瑞典，宗教派别开办的学校是合法的。在前言中，我写到了位于瑞典南部 Hyltebruk 的基督教末日教派普利茅斯兄弟会。这个教派开办了自己的学校，只有父母属于该教派的孩子才能上学。教众总共约有四百人，这可能是当今瑞典最极端的教派。他们的宗教观点与传统的基督教观点大相径庭。

In Sweden, schools run by religious sects are legal. In the prelude, I wrote about the Christian doomsday sect known as the Plymouth Brothers, located in Hyltebruk, in southern Sweden. This sect runs its own school, attended only by children whose parents belong to the sect. The congregation consists of about four hundred people all told, and it is probably the most extreme sect in Sweden today. Their religious views diverge considerably from traditional Christian ones.

20 世纪 60 年代，普利茅斯兄弟会当时的领袖宣布世界末日即将来临，敌基督已经占领了世界。因此，该教派成员被告知要切断与外界的一切联系。从那时起，与“异教徒”——即不属于该教派的人——完全隔离就成了该教派日常生活和实践的核心。据说，这样孩子们就能得救，免于永远被地狱“火海”烧死的命运。该教派成员不得与任何外来人一起吃饭或分享住处。他们不能住在教派外任何人拥有的任何建筑物中，也不能住在任何非成员居住的建筑物中。他们甚至不能与教派外的任何人签订合同。

In the 1960s, the Plymouth Brothers’ then leader announced that doomsday was nigh, and that the Antichrist had taken over the world. The group’s members were therefore told to cut off all contact with the outside world. Ever since then, total isolation from “infidels”—that is, from those who do not belong to the group—has been central in the sect’s daily life and practice. Children would supposedly be saved in this way, spared from the fate of burning forever in hell’s “sea of fire.” Members of the sect are not allowed to eat with or share their living quarters with any outsider. They cannot live in any building owned by anyone outside the sect, nor live in a building in which any nonmembers live. They cannot even sign a contract with anyone outside the sect.

这些人认为外部世界是邪恶的，是魔鬼的作品。该教派的年轻成员被指示远离学术研究，以免在上帝眼中显得骄傲；此外，已婚妇女被禁止外出工作。男人被视为女人的上级。同性恋是魔鬼的杰作，上帝对同性恋的惩罚就是死亡。该教派对圣经的解释是字面意思，因此是神创论者；他们相信人类是在大约六千年前被创造出来的。进化论被视为一种胡说八道，只会让人类远离上帝。

These people see the outside world as evil, as a work of the devil. The young members of the sect are instructed to steer clear of academic studies, so as not to seem prideful in God’s eyes; moreover, married women are forbidden from working outside the home. Men are seen as women’s superiors. Homosexuality is the work of demons, and God’s rightful punishment for it is death. The sect’s interpretation of the Bible is literal and therefore creationist; they believe that humanity was created some six thousand years ago. The theory of evolution is seen as a piece of nonsense that is simply carrying humanity away from God.

在普利茅斯兄弟会长大的孩子不允许在教派外交朋友。他们不能参加当地青年足球联赛，也不能和当地音乐学校的孩子们一起演奏音乐。当团体中的孩子年满 12 岁时，他或她必须做出选择：“你是支持我们还是反对我们？”任何选择质疑教派的孩子都会被赶出社区，甚至不能再与家人一起吃饭。

Children who grow up in the Plymouth Brothers’ sect are not allowed to have friends outside of the sect. They don’t play soccer in the local youth soccer league, nor do they make music with children in the local music school. And when a child in the group reaches the age of twelve, he or she is given a choice: “Are you with us or against us?” Any child who chooses to question the sect is thrown out of the community and no longer can even eat meals with their own family.

以前，对于这些孩子来说，当地的公立学校是一扇通往世界的窗户，是与其他同龄孩子建立正常关系的大门。但在 2007 年，该教派被合法允许开办一所只招收本教子女的学校，而且这所学校和瑞典其他学校一样，获得了一些国家资助。这种情况无异于用税收资助对本已处于弱势地位的儿童群体进行心理攻击。

Some time ago, for such children, the local public school was a window onto the world, an opening toward normal relations with other children of the same age. But in 2007, the sect was legally permitted to run a school solely for its own children, and the school, just like other schools in Sweden, was provided some state funding. This state of affairs is nothing less than a tax-financed act of psychological aggression on an already disadvantaged group of children.

学校的宗教教育

Religious Education in Schools

2011 年，瑞典国家教育局为中小学的宗教教育制定了新课程。新课程无疑比以前的课程更好：更广泛、更客观、更具包容性。新课程首次保证学生将学习世俗人文主义。这意味着，如果遵循课程，孩子们就会明白，人生的道德哲学并不需要建立在超自然事件的故事、一个或多个神的存在或任何形式的神奇力量或力量之上。事实上，如果立法者认真对待自己的法律，那么被称为“宗教教育”的主题本身就必须改名为“人生哲学教育”（或类似的名称）；然而，他们不敢在课程改革上走得那么远。 （正如我们所见，所有宗教都可以被描述为“人生哲学”，但并非所有的人生哲学都是宗教。因此，任何宗教都会成为人生哲学课程的有效候选者，但反之则不然。

In 2011, the Swedish National Agency for Education established a new curriculum for religious education in elementary and secondary schools. The new curriculum was indisputably better than the previous one: broader, more objective, and more inclusive. And in it was included, for the first time ever, a guarantee that pupils would be taught about secular humanism. This would imply that, if the curriculum were followed, children would come to understand that a moral philosophy of life doesn’t need to rest on stories of supernatural events, or on the existence of one or more gods, or on any kind of magical forces or powers. In fact, if the legislators took their own law seriously, then the very subject matter known as “religious education” would have to be renamed “education about philosophies of life” (or something along those lines); however, they didn’t dare go that far with their curriculum reform. (As we have seen, all religions could be described as “philosophies of life,” but not all philosophies of life are religions. Thus any religion would be a valid candidate for inclusion in a class on philosophies of life but not vice versa.)

在国家制定的宗教教育课程中，七年级至九年级的学生将学习以下主题：

In the nationally established curriculum for religious education, pupils in the seventh through ninth school years would learn about the following topics:

  • 基督教的主要思想和经典以及基督教三大分支（新教、天主教和东正教）的突出特征；
  • the main ideas and scriptures of Christianity and the outstanding features that characterize Christianity’s three main branches (Protestantism, Catholicism, and the Eastern Orthodox Church);
  • 其他世界主要宗教的主要思想和经典，如伊斯兰教、犹太教、印度教和佛教；
  • the main ideas and scriptures of other major world religions, such as Islam, Judaism, Hinduism, and Buddhism;
  • 世界各大宗教在当今社会中有着不同的解释和实践；
  • various interpretations and practices, in the world’s major religions, in today’s society;
  • 世界主要宗教历史概述；
  • an outline of the history of the world’s major religions;
  • 新的宗教运动、新的宗教类型和个人宗教，以及这些发展是如何产生的；
  • new religious movements, new types of religiousness, and personal religiousness, as well as how such developments have arisen; and
  • 世俗的人生观点，包括世俗人文主义。
  • secular points of view on life, including secular humanism.

瑞典国家教育局还发布了一份文件，对课程进行了更详细的评论。其中有以下内容：

The Swedish National Agency for Education also published a document with more detailed comments about the curriculum. In it one finds the following:

7 至 9 年级的课程要求学习世俗的人生哲学。这些哲学往往基于科学的世界观，它们不认为道德价值观有神圣的起源。相反，它们提倡这样一种观点，即道德原则完全可以由人类自己创造的思想来证明。……这种特征适用于世俗人文主义等众所周知的人生哲学……

例如，无神论意味着否认任何神的存在。从这样的基础出发，人们可以对许多事情形成其他概念，从宇宙的起源到伦理问题，但无神论世界观本身并不意味着对其他类型问题有独特的答案。2

In grades 7 through 9, the curriculum mandates coverage of secular philosophies of life. Such philosophies are often based on a scientific world-view and they do not see ethical values as having a divine origin. Instead, they promote the idea that ethical principles can be completely justified by thoughts that human themselves create. . . . This characterization applies to such well-known philosophies of life as secular humanism . . .

Atheism, for example, implies that one denies the existence of any god. Starting from such a basis, one can then form other conceptions about many things, ranging from the origin of the universe to ethical issues, but having an atheistic worldview per se does not imply unique answers to other types of questions.2

当这个新课程被接受时，我自然非常好奇世俗的观点将如何在教科书中呈现。可惜结果并不令人鼓舞。

When this new curriculum was accepted, I was naturally very curious as to how the secular perspective would be presented in schoolbooks. The result was not very encouraging, alas.

我查阅的几本书都很旧了，但我也查阅了新课程实施后更新的书籍。这些教材往往充斥着概念上的混淆和明显的错误。事实是错误的，但最重要的是，世俗的人生哲学通常被错误地描述，并带有宗教色彩。

Several of the books that I checked were quite old, but I also looked at ones that had been updated after the new curriculum had been adopted. These texts were often riddled with conceptual confusions and blatant errors of fact, but most important, secular philosophies of life were generally described inaccurately and from a religiously colored perspective.

可以肯定的是，有些教科书成功地以典范的方式介绍了这个主题；然而，做得不好的教科书数量远远超过做得好的教科书。我非常仔细地查阅了教育家兼牧师 Börge Ring 撰写的几本教科书（以及其他教科书）。Ring 的牧师光环在他的著作中随处可见，这在教科书中是不可接受的，因为教科书应该对人生哲学保持完全中立。我选择单独挑出这位作家作为例子，但这个问题在我研究的大多数文本中几乎随处可见。

To be sure, there are some schoolbooks that succeed in presenting the topic in an exemplary manner; however, ones that do a poor job outnumber those that do a good job by a very large factor. I very carefully checked out (among others) several textbooks written by educator and priest Börge Ring. Ring’s priestly aura shines through everywhere in his writings, which is unacceptable in schoolbooks that are supposed to be totally neutral with respect to philosophies of life. I have chosen to single out this particular writer as an example, but the problem recurs almost everywhere in the majority of texts that I examined.

在 Ring 的书《宗教——helt enkelt》（简单呈现的宗教）中，世俗人文主义只在最后一章被讨论，与耶和华见证人、摩门教、神创论和撒旦教并列！Börge Ring 对魔鬼崇拜的痴迷是他许多书中的主题，这与撒旦教在世界上非常稀少（事实上，微不足道）的分布完全不符。

In Ring’s book Religion—helt enkelt (Religion, Simply Presented), secular humanism is discussed only in the last chapter, side by side with Jehovah’s Witnesses, the Mormon Church, creationism, and Satanism! Börge Ring’s obsession with devil worship is a running theme in many of his books, and it does not correspond in any way to the very sparse—in fact, vanishingly small—distribution of Satanism in the world.

这些文本的草率不仅限于描述世俗人生哲学的段落。例如，在一段关于进化论否定者和创造论者的段落中，林格说：“创造论和科学是相互对立的，关于它们的讨论包含许多晦涩难懂的物理学论点。” 3

The sloppiness in such texts is not limited to those passages that describe the secular philosophy of life. For example, in a passage dealing with evolution deniers and creationists, Ring says: “[C]reationism and science are in opposition to each other, and the discussions about them contain many obscure arguments concerning physics.”3

当然，科学和神创论是不相容的，这是完全正确的，但争议涉及生物学，而不是物理学。后来，林写道：“[神创论]的追随者人数无法准确说明，但只有在美国，这一运动才有很大的影响力。” 4

Of course it is perfectly correct that science and creationism are incompatible, but the controversy concerns biology, not physics. Later, Ring writes: “The number of followers [of creationism] cannot be accurately stated, but it is only in the United States that the movement has had much influence.”4

这不太对。虽然神创论（以及它的表亲“智能设计”）迄今为止在瑞典的影响力还不是很大，但它不仅在瑞典自由教会中被经常引用，而且在世界各地的福音派基督教运动中也经常被引用——这是目前基督教中发展最为迅速的分支。此外，神创论也是伊斯兰教的主流信仰，在许多伊斯兰国家都具有非常强大的影响力。

This is not quite right. Although creationism (along with its cousin, “intelligent design”) has so far not had a very large influence in Sweden, it is frequently cited not only in the Swedish free churches but also in the evangelical Christian movement throughout the world—and that is the branch of Christianity that is most on the rise at the present time. Moreover, creationism is also the dominant belief in Islam, and it exerts a very powerful influence in many Islamic countries.

这些段落的作者混淆了作为一种生活哲学的“世俗人文主义”与“人文主义”一词的其他含义，例如教育术语“人文学科”，或将人文主义视为任何一种与人性的接触，显然，无论一个人是基督徒，穆斯林，还是世俗人文主义者。世俗人文主义作为一种生活哲学的真正本质完全被作者（以及他的所有读者）所忽视。

The author of these passages blurs together “secular humanism” as a philosophy of life with other meanings of the word “humanism,” such as the educational term “the humanities,” or humanism as any kind of engagement with humanity, which one can obviously have, whether one is a Christian, a Muslim, or a secular humanist. The true nature of secular humanism as a philosophy of life completely eludes the writer (and hence all of his readers).

Ring 还在书中试图解释科学是什么。该主题大约只用了半页的篇幅，章节标题为：“科学能告诉我们什么是正确的吗？”他这样描述科学：

Ring also attempts, in his book, to explain what science is. The topic is covered in roughly one half a page, and the section title is: “Can Science Tell Us What Is Right?” He describes science in the following manner:

“科学”一词的意思是“知识”。从事科学研究的人会整理和组织知识片段。这可以通过调查、访谈、文本分析或观察物体来收集知识片段。研究人员还可以通过对人或动物进行实验来收集知识。如果你问不同的研究人员哪一个是正确的，你会得到许多不同的答案。一些研究人员甚至不想回答这个问题，而另一些研究人员会给出模糊、难以捉摸的答案。如果连研究人员自己都不知道谁是对的，那么别人怎么会知道呢？5

The word “science” means “knowledge.” Someone who does scientific research arranges and organizes pieces of knowledge. This can be done by collecting pieces of knowledge through investigations, interviews, analyses of text, or observations of objects. A researcher can also gather knowledge by conducting experiments on people or animals. If you were to ask different researchers which of them is right, you would get many different answers. Some researchers wouldn’t even wish to answer the question, while others would give vague, elusive answers. If even the researchers themselves don’t know who is right, then how can anyone know?5

显然，任何通过这种怪异的描述了解“科学”概念的人都不会对它产生丝毫的兴趣。如果“连研究人员自己都不知道”，那又何必去研究它呢？

It’s clear that anyone who is introduced to the notion of “science” through this bizarre description will not have the least interest in it. If “even the researchers themselves don’t know,” then why bother with it at all?

当然，林格对科学的半心半意的描述具有极大的误导性。诚然，科学家之间也存在争议，但在绝大多数情况下，科学家对于哪些理论有效、哪些理论无效以及世界上事物的行为方式都意见一致。

Of course Ring’s halfhearted portrait of science is profoundly misleading. To be sure, there are controversies among scientists, but in the overwhelming majority of cases, scientists are in agreement on which theories work and which don’t, and on how things in the world behave.

在他的著作《宗教和诸如此类的事情》（2013 年）中，林格有机会更新他以前的著作，将新课程考虑在内。但相反，在这本新书中，世俗人文主义概念的模糊性变得更加模糊。看一看：“伊斯兰教是一种宗教生活哲学，而人文主义可以是宗教哲学，也可以是非宗教哲学。” 6

In his book Religion och sånt (Religion and Such Things, 2013), Ring had the chance to update his previous books, taking into account the new curriculum. But instead, in this new book, the blur around the notion of secular humanism becomes even blurrier. Take a look: “Islam is a religious philosophy of life, while humanism can be a religious or a nonreligious philosophy.”6

如果“人文主义”仅仅指“人文学科”或“任何形式的人文主义活动”，那么这种说法是正确的，但如果你指的是作为一种人生哲学的“人文主义” ，那么这种说法就完全是错误的。大多数人都意识到，世俗人文主义被视为一种人生哲学，这是新课程的意图，完全是非宗教的。

This is true if by “humanism” you merely mean “the humanities” or “any sort of engagement with humanity,” but if you mean “humanism” as a philosophy of life, then it is utterly false. Secular humanism seen as a philosophy of life, which was the intent under the new curriculum, is totally nonreligious, as most people realize.

接下来，作者讨论了无神论的概念，他似乎也希望将其描绘成一种生活哲学，尽管事实并非如此。他发表了一个明显错误的陈述，以问题的形式向将要阅读他的书的学生提出：“你是否同意无神论的观点，即除了我们看到和可以测量的世界之外，什么都不存在？” 7

Next, the author tackles the concept of atheism, which he also seems to wish to portray as a philosophy of life, even though this is certainly not the case. He makes a blatantly false statement, couched as a question posed to the students who will read his book: “Do you agree with atheism that nothing exists except the world that we see and can measure?”7

正如我们所见，无神论者可以相信鬼魂、顺势疗法或占星术，因为无神论者不需要分享世俗人文主义为他们提供的丰富人生哲学。此外，无神论者显然可以相信各种看不见或无法衡量的事物：爱、平等、人权、其他星球上的生命……

As we have seen, an atheist can believe in ghosts, homeopathy, or astrology, since atheists don’t need to share the rich philosophy of life that secular humanism offers them. Moreover, atheists can obviously believe in all sorts of things that one cannot see or measure: love, equality, human rights, life on other planets . . .

但很明显，Ring 问题的提出方式是为了阻止学生称自己为“无神论者”；毕竟，谁会愿意愚蠢到只相信自己能看到和测量到的东西呢？

It is clear, though, that Ring’s question was formulated in such a way as to discourage students from calling themselves “atheists”; after all, who would want to be so deadly dull as to believe only in what one can see and measure?

在这本 220 页的书中，林格只用了四页来描述世俗人文主义（他给它的定义很模糊，将其等同于无神论），而用了二十页来描述佛教。同样值得注意的是，根据一项关于世界生活哲学的国际调查8，大约有 22 亿基督徒、16 亿穆斯林和 9 亿印度教徒。排在第四位的是非宗教哲学，大约有 7.5 亿人。世俗人文主义当然也属于这一范畴。佛教仅排在第七位，大约有 3.5 亿信徒。

In his 220-page book, Ring devotes just four pages to secular humanism (with the blurry definition he gives it, identifying it with atheism), while he devotes twenty pages to Buddhism. Also worth noticing in this connection is the fact that, according to an international survey of the world’s philosophies of life,8 there are roughly 2.2 billion Christians, 1.6 billion Muslims, and 900 million Hindus. In fourth place come nonreligious philosophies, with roughly 750 million people. Secular humanism of course falls under this rubric. Buddhism comes in only in seventh place, with roughly 350 million followers.

在本书的早期版本（至今仍在使用）中，新纪元运动也受到了批评，但原因并非教科书所期望的那样。该运动被描述为“对基督教和其他主要宗教的抗议”：“新纪元信徒反对大多数既定宗教，尤其是基督教。” 9

In an earlier (and still used) edition of the book, the New Age movement also comes in for criticism, but not for the reasons one might hope in a textbook. The movement is presented as “A protest against Christianity and other major religions”: “New Age believers are opposed to most established religions, and especially Christianity.”9

现在有很多理由批评新纪元运动，但这绝不是其中之一。事实上，新纪元运动的主要目标并不是基督教，而是理性思维和普遍的科学态度。（在瑞典的某些自由教会中，新纪元运动被视为一场神秘运动，全是关于恶灵、魔鬼和其他邪​​恶生物。也许这就是让 Börge Ring 感到困扰的原因。）

Now there are many grounds on which to criticize the New Age movement, but this is hardly one of them. It is not Christianity that is in fact the New Age movement’s primary target but, instead, rational thinking and a scientific attitude in general. (In certain free churches in Sweden, the New Age movement is looked upon as an occult movement that is all about evil spirits, demons, and other unholy beings. Perhaps this is what troubles Börge Ring.)

在 Ring 的书的更新版本（2013 年）中，刚刚引用的那段话被删除了。取而代之的是，人们读到的是当今与据说生活在数千年前的灵魂的交流：

In the updated version of Ring’s book (2013), the just-quoted statement has been taken out. In its place, one reads about present-day communication with a spirit who supposedly lived thousands of years ago:

在韦姆兰（瑞典斯德哥尔摩以西的一个郡）住着一位名叫斯图雷·约翰逊的前木匠，他可以从一位名叫安布雷斯的古埃及人那里获得事实和经验。当斯图雷·约翰逊收到这位男子的信息时，他称自己为安布雷斯。他通过开设课程，参与者可以熟悉一种早已消失的生活方式，但现在可以通过 Sture Johansson 获得这种生活方式。10

In Värmland [a Swedish county west of Stockholm] there lives a former carpenter named Sture Johansson, who can channel facts and experiences from a man named Ambres, who lived in ancient Egypt. When Sture Johansson receives messages from this man, he calls himself Ambres. He gives courses in which the participants become acquainted with a long-gone mode of life, but one that is now accessible through Sture Johansson.10

在 Börge Ring 的更新版《宗教与教育》 11中，尽管这本书是在新课程实施两年后出版的，但呈现方式并没有好多少。出版商已被告知早期版本中的所有错误，但在印刷修订版之前选择忽略其中的许多错误。

In Börge Ring’s updated book Religion och sammanhang,11 the presentation is not much better, although the book was published two years after the new curriculum had come into force. The publisher had been informed about all the errors in earlier editions but had chosen to ignore many of them before printing the revised edition.

在这本书中，Ring 继续痴迷于撒旦教，鉴于其在世界上的微不足道，撒旦教被赋予了过大的角色。世俗人文主义（再次与“人文主义”的其他含义混淆在一起）以及无神论只占了这本书 350 页中的 4 页，而佛教则占了 39 页。

In this book, Ring continues to be obsessed with Satanism, which is given an unreasonably large role, given its minimal relevance in the world. And secular humanism (once again blurred together with other meanings of “humanism”), along with atheism, takes up just four of the book’s 350 pages, as compared to Buddhism’s thirty-nine pages.

在最新版本中，作者思考了无神论是否是一种人生哲学，最后他含糊其辞地说无神论“首先是一种人生取向”。这是一种进步，因为他不再将无神论描述为人生哲学，但他所说的“人生取向”是什么意思呢？想必这会是贯穿一个人一生的东西。例如，一位毕生致力于寻找癌症治疗方法的研究人员肯定会将研究作为人生取向。马拉松比赛很可能是埃利乌德·基普乔格的人生取向。但将不跑马拉松或不寻求癌症治疗方法称为“人生取向”是没有意义的。

In the latest edition, the author considers whether atheism is a philosophy of life or not, and he winds up making the fuzzy statement that it is “above all a life orientation.” This is progress, in the sense that he no longer describes atheism as a philosophy of life, but what does he mean by “a life orientation”? Presumably this would be something that would pervade a person’s life. For instance, a researcher who has dedicated their life to seeking a cure for cancer would surely have research as a life orientation. And very likely marathon running is a life orientation for Eliud Kipchoge. But it wouldn’t make sense to call not running marathons or not seeking a cure for cancer a “life orientation.”

博尔格·林格关于无神论的非理性观念很可能是他作为一名牧师所受训练的结果，但这些观念并不适合出现在 2015 年的教科书中。

Börge Ring’s irrational notions about atheism are most likely a consequence of his training as a priest, but they are hardly appropriate material to appear in textbooks in the year 2015.

然而，Ring 的《宗教与三昧》一书最荒谬之处莫过于以下内容。在书中（第 326 页），查尔斯·达尔文被推崇为撒旦教徒的偶像和鼓舞人心的思想家！即使这本书的作者真的能找出一些愚蠢的撒旦教徒兴高采烈地宣称“达尔文是我的英雄！”，但这也不是达尔文的思想在科学和人类思维中如此重要的原因。

The most absurd aspect of Ring’s book Religion och sammanhang, however, has to be the following. In it (on page 326), Charles Darwin is held up as an idol and an inspirational thinker for Satanists! Even if the book’s author were actually able to dig up some addle-headed Satanist who gleefully declared “Darwin is my hero!,” it’s not as if this is why Darwin’s ideas have come to have such importance in science and in human thinking more generally.

博尔格·林的书中有很多错误、误导性表述和过分夸张的描述。2014 年，我参加了一个研讨会，与作者本人讨论了作者的想法。研讨会被拍摄下来，可以在网上完整观看。12

There are many examples of errors, misleading formulations, and heavy-handed descriptions in Börge Ring’s books. In 2014, I took part in a seminar in which the author’s ideas were discussed with the author himself. It was filmed and can be seen in its entirety on the web.12

学校的全新生活哲学

A Fresh New Philosophy of Life for Schools

我为什么要如此详细地讲述这一切？因为如果我们关心要教给孩子什么，这些问题就非常重要。我们不仅希望看到传授哪些事实，而且希望看到传递哪些价值观。

Why have I gone through all this in such detail? Well, such matters are very important if we are concerned about what we are going to teach our children. It’s not just which facts we hope to see taught but also which values we hope to see transmitted.

我们需要摆脱道德与宗教密不可分的普遍误解。道德思考可以而且应该在不参考宗教先入之见的情况下进行。如果我们在学校里教导孩子们，通往道德的唯一途径是建立在宗教的基础上，那么我们就走上了一条非常危险的道路。年轻人必须有机会接触非宗教的人生哲学，从中可以得出关于伦理和生存问题的明智态度。

We need to move away from the common misconception that ethics is irrevocably linked with religion. Moral thinking can and should be carried out without reference to religious preconceptions. If in school we teach our children that the only route leading to morality is based on religion, then we are heading down a very dangerous pathway. Young people must be given the opportunity to encounter nonreligious philosophies of life out of which flow sensible attitudes concerning ethical and existential questions.

我们还需要摆脱“无神论是一种人生哲学”的观念，以及“无神论是一种枯燥无味的世界观”的观念。

We also need to move away from the notion that atheism is a philosophy of life, as well as the notion that it is a dull and boring attitude toward the world.

我们必须让孩子们对世界各地存在和盛行的众多不同的人生哲学有一个广泛、中立和客观的看法。最后但并非最不重要的是，教育材料出版商有一项重要职责，即确保他们出版的内容揭示和赞扬世界各地存在的各种各样的哲学。

Our children must be offered a broad, neutral, and objective view of the many diverse philosophies of life that exist and flourish all around our world. And last but not least, publishers of educational material have the important duty of being sure that what they publish reveals and celebrates the enormous variety of philosophies that can be found throughout the world.

插曲：关于自然与超自然

INTERLUDE: ON THE NATURAL AND THE SUPERNATURAL

我们真的能确定没有超自然的事情发生吗？

Can we really be sure that there isn’t anything supernatural?

在我十几岁的时候，我经常去拜访一对老夫妇，他们声称用一台大型开盘磁带录音机，把死人的声音录在磁带上。我去他们家的时候，听了很多他们的磁带，磁带里发出噼啪声和嘶嘶声。偶尔你还能听到说话的声音。

When I was in my early teens, I used to go visit an elderly couple who claimed that, using a big reel-to-reel tape recorder, they had recorded the voices of dead people on tape. On my visits to their home, I listened to many of their tapes, which crackled and hissed. Every once in a while you could make out the sound of voices.

我们用他们的录音机录制降神会。有一次，他们居然出版了一本小书，名为《De döda talar på band》（《死者在录音带上说话》）。我对他们的说法深感着迷，后来我拿到了他们的录音机，并试图自己调查灵魂的声音。但不幸的是，我从来没有录下任何声音。

We used their tape recorder for recording seances. At one point, they actually came out with a little book called “De döda talar på band” (“The Dead Speak on Tape”). I was deeply fascinated by their claims, and later I got a hold of their tape recorder and tried to conduct my own investigations of spirit voices. Unfortunately, though, I never managed to record any.

超自然现象的概念是基于对“自然”一词含义的误解。如果普通用语中被称为“超自然”的现象真的存在，那么它们就不是超自然现象。它们只是到今天都无法解释。对于 ESP 和录音来说也是如此死人说话、心灵感应等等。如果这些现象真的存在，那么它就是自然现象，而不是超自然现象。

The idea of the supernatural is based on a misconception of what the word “natural” means. If the phenomena that are called “supernatural” in common parlance really existed, then they wouldn’t be supernatural. They would simply be unexplained as of today. That would hold for ESP, for recordings of dead people talking, for telekinesis, and so forth. If any of them can really be shown to exist, then it will be a natural, not a supernatural, phenomenon.

当我们研究各种现象时，无论何种类型，我们首先都应该尝试找到该现象存在的证据；然后，我们再寻求解释。以读心术为例。如果我们想自己弄清楚读心术是否存在，我们首先要从实验室环境开始，在实验室环境中测试它是否有效。如果我们找到支持它的证据，那么我们找到的证据就不是超自然的东西，而是一种真实存在但尚未解释的现象。

When we investigate various phenomena, no matter of what type, we should first try to find evidence that the phenomena exist; after that, we seek explanations for them. Take mind reading, for example. If we wish to figure out for ourselves whether mind reading exists or not, we start with a laboratory situation in which we can test if it works. If we find evidence supporting it, then what we’ve found evidence for is not something supernatural but a genuinely existing though as-of-yet unexplained phenomenon.

下一步是试图弄清楚它是如何运作的。这是否涉及一种前所未见的自然力量？还是一种未知的生物现象？只有当我们对这一现象制定出一些合理的理论时，我们才有可能开始希望解释它。但如果我们没有证据表明这一现象确实存在，那么制定理论就毫无意义。

The next step is to try to figure out how it works. Does this involve a never-before-seen force of nature? Or is it an unknown biological phenomenon? Only when we have worked out some plausible theories about the phenomenon can we begin to hope to explain it. But it would be meaningless to formulate a theory unless we have evidence that the phenomenon actually exists.

真正存在的东西是自然的一部分，因此是自然的，而不是超自然的。不存在的东西也不是超自然的；它只是不存在。如果死者的灵魂最终到达“另一边”并与我们交流，那将是一种自然但尚未解释的现象。

What truly exists is part of nature, and thus is natural, not supernatural. What doesn’t exist is also not supernatural; it is simply nonexistent. If the souls of the deceased wound up on “the other side” and communicated with us, that would be a natural but as-of-yet unexplained phenomenon.

“天然”常常与所谓的“非天然”形成对比。因此，我们有“天然”食品和草药，有些人认为它们比“非天然”食品和药物更好。但这到底意味着什么？一些不是特别天然的药物仍然非常有效。“天然”食品并不总是比其他类型的食品更有营养。

The “natural” is often contrasted with what is said to be “unnatural.” Thus we have “natural” foods and herbal medicines, and some people believe them to be better than “unnatural” foods and medicines. But what does this really mean? Some medicines that are not particularly natural are nonetheless very effective. “Natural” food isn’t always more nutritious than other types of food.

想象一下，把一个城市居民带到瑞典的森林里，唯一的任务就是依靠森林提供的东西生存。城市居民可能活不了多久。食用蘑菇等天然产品极其危险。

Imagine taking a city dweller into a Swedish forest with the sole mission of surviving on the basis of what the forest offers. The city dweller probably won’t live very long. Natural products, such as mushrooms, can be extremely dangerous to eat.

我经常与瑞典各地的瑞典自由教会（不是官方的路德宗）领袖进行辩论。他们经常声称同性恋不仅不正常，而且违反自然。

I have often debated with the leaders of Swedish free churches (not the official state brand of Lutheranism) all around Sweden. Quite often they claim that homosexuality is not only abnormal but also unnatural.

事实恰恰相反。一定比例的人（以及动物）是同性恋，因此同性恋是最自然不过的事情。“但同性恋者不能生孩子！”是对此论点的常见反驳。但地球正受到人口过剩的威胁，如果地球上的居民减少一点，地球就不会受到伤害。从这个角度来看，如果更多的人是同性恋，情况会更好。

The truth is quite the opposite. A certain percentage of people (and also of animals) are homosexual, so that homosexuality is as natural as you can get. “But homosexuals cannot make babies!” is a frequent rejoinder to this argument. But the earth is menaced by overpopulation, and it would not be harmed if there were fewer inhabitants on its surface. From that perspective, it would be distinctly better if more people were homosexual.

此外，开车、住公寓楼或服用青霉素等抗生素并不是那么“自然”。因此，当你提倡“自然”生活时要小心。

Moreover, it isn’t so “natural” to drive cars, live in apartment buildings, or to take antibiotics like penicillin. So be careful when you advocate living “naturally.”

后记和致谢

AFTERWORD AND WORDS OF THANKS

“W“我们生活在最好的世界里！”伏尔泰的《老实人》中潘格罗斯大师感叹道。这是真的吗？在故事中，老实人被迫来到这个世界，经历了一个又一个的恐怖，一个比一个糟糕：自然灾害、酷刑、战争、谋杀、屠杀、强奸和背叛。伏尔泰的这部小说当然是对乐观主义的讽刺，也是对神正论问题的直面：如果真有一位善良、全知、全能的上帝，世界上怎么会有这么多苦难？

“We live in the best of all possible worlds!” exclaims Master Pangloss in Voltaire’s Candide. Is that really true? In the tale, Candide is forced out into the world, where he experiences one horror after another, each worse than the previous one: natural disasters, torture, war, murder, massacres, rapes, and betrayals. Voltaire’s novel is of course a satire on optimism, as well as a confrontation with the problem of theodicy: if there is a good, omniscient, and almighty God, how can there be so much suffering in the world?

理性的火焰在黑暗中微弱地闪烁，在当今世界，这种现象太常见了。关于秘密世界秩序通过注射疫苗的微芯片控制人类的离奇阴谋论正在盛行。宗教原教旨主义正在世界许多地方加强其地位。

The flame of reason flickers faintly in the dark, and does so much too often in the world today. Bizarre conspiracy theories about a secret world order controlling humans with microchips injected with vaccine are flourishing. Religious fundamentalism is strengthening its position in many parts of the world.

但我充满希望。理性和科学帮助我们大多数人度过了一场流行病，如果这场流行病发生在五十年前，可能会夺去更多人的生命（但那时可能不会传播得这么快）。尽管信息技术和通信技术正在像野火一样传播糟糕和疯狂的想法，但幸运的是，它们也在帮助传播好的想法和科学知识。技术是一把双刃剑。

But I am hopeful. Reason and science have helped most of us survive a pandemic that would have killed many more if it had taken place fifty years ago (but it probably wouldn’t have spread so fast back in those days). And although information technology and communication technology are spreading bad and crazy ideas like wildfire, luckily they are also helping spread good ideas and scientific knowledge. Technology is a double-edged sword.

我们这些对生活抱有世俗观点的人不需要努力应对神正论的困境。相反，我们自己会利用我们手头的工具来承担起我们的世界和我们在其中的存在的责任：理性、创造力、好奇心、同情心和反思能力。通过这样做，我们甚至可能成长为更真实的自己。

Those of us who have a secular outlook on life do not need to grapple with the dilemma of theodicy. Instead, we ourselves take responsibility for our world and our existence in it with the help of the tools we have at hand: reason, creativity, curiosity, compassion, and the ability to reconsider. By so doing, we may even grow into more authentic versions of ourselves.

带我飞向月球，让我在星空间玩耍

让我看看木星和火星上的春天是什么样的

Fly me to the moon, let me play among the stars

Let me see what spring is like, on Jupiter and Mars

巴特·霍华德创作的经典歌曲《带我去月球》传达了存在主义的眩晕感和存在的幸福感，尽管这种幸福只有短暂的片刻，但随着每个世纪的流逝，这个世界对我们所有人来说都变得越来越美好。

The classic song Fly Me to the Moon, written by Bart Howard, conveys the feeling of existential vertigo and the happiness of existence, if only for a short time, in a world that becomes a better place for all of us with each passing century.

我们应该记住人类渴望探索我们自己以外的世界；这是我们内心蕴藏的奇妙探索之乐的终极体现。

We should remember humanity’s desire to discover worlds beyond our own; that is the ultimate example of the fantastic joy of discovery we all carry within us.

尽管 2020 年和 2021 年是全球疫情肆虐的一年，但这两年我们却将目光投向了外部，探索了我们的太阳系。美国、中国和阿联酋都在 2021 年进行了（非人类）火星探险。人类要到火星还需要一段时间，但在此期间，研究火星表面的机器人将提供许多新知识。

Although 2020 and 2021 were years of a global pandemic, they were also years in which we looked outward and explored our solar system. The United States, China, and the United Arab Emirates all executed (nonhuman) expeditions to Mars in 2021. It will be a while longer before humans travel to the Red Planet, but robots that study the planet’s surface will in the meantime provide much new knowledge.

也许大卫·鲍伊的经典歌曲《火星生活》最终会成为现实。人类再次登陆月球也在计划之中。想象一下，用今天的视听技术从地球上观看这样的航行将是多么美妙的体验。

Perhaps David Bowie’s iconic song “Life on Mars” will finally come true. Renewed human visits to the moon are also in the planning. Imagine what a wonderful experience it will be to observe such voyages from earth with today’s audiovisual technology.

值得一提的是，全球科学界为研发和生产有效疫苗而展开的合作是科学力量的伟大见证。据估计，19 世纪各种疫苗的发现和开发以及 20 世纪初青霉素的发明和开发挽救了数亿人的生命。

It’s worth pointing out that global scientific cooperation in the effort to discover and produce effective vaccines against the pandemic is a magnificent testimony to the power of science. The discovery and development of various vaccines in the nineteenth century, and of penicillin in the early twentieth century, are estimated to have saved hundreds of millions of lives.

但战争、民粹主义、民族主义和种族主义呢？情况不是越来越糟了吗？我们记忆犹新的是两次毁灭性的世界大战，以及最近发生的许多战争，而今天的宗教原教旨主义和恐怖主义似乎并不是“所有可能世界中最好的”。另一方面，今天死于暴力的风险比历史上任何时候都要低。我们寿命更长，我们更健康，更多的孩子可以上学，挨饿的人更少。

But what of war, populism, nationalism, and racism? Aren’t things just getting worse? Fresh in our memories are two devastating world wars, as well as so many more recent wars, and today’s religious fundamentalism and terrorism hardly seem to be “the best of all possible worlds.” On the other hand, the risk of dying from violence today is lower than ever before in history. We live longer, we are healthier, more children are allowed to go to school, and fewer people are starving.

人们有时会说，希腊哲学家是第一批拥有足够平静的心态，能够思考抽象概念的人。也许这是真的；无论如何，我们今天正朝着这个方向前进。

It is sometimes said that the Greek philosophers were the first to enjoy enough peace of mind to have the chance to ruminate on abstract ideas. Maybe that’s true; in any case, we today are heading ever more in that direction.

如果我们从鸟瞰的角度看，可以说今天我们确实生活在所有可能世界中最好的世界，或者至少是人类历史上最好的时代。在个人生活中，这种乐观主义似乎值得怀疑，尤其是在全球疫情期间。然而，音乐可以作为一个提醒——一个仁慈而美丽的提醒，促使我们即使在生活处于最低谷时也要满怀希望地向上看。正如查理·卓别林的经典歌曲所说：

If we take a bird’s-eye point of view, it’s fair to say that today we actually do live in the best of all possible worlds, or at least in the best of all eras of human history. In one’s own personal life, such optimism can seem dubious, especially in the midst of a global pandemic. Music, however, can serve as a reminder—a benevolent and beautiful reminder urging us to look up with hope, even when life is at its lowest. As in the classic song composed by Charlie Chaplin:

微笑吧，尽管你的心很痛

微笑，即使心碎

当天空有云的时候，你就能挺过去。

如果你微笑面对恐惧和悲伤，

微笑——也许明天，

你会看到太阳为你照耀。1

Smile, though your heart is aching

Smile, even though it’s breaking

When there are clouds in the sky, you’ll get by.

If you smile through your fear and sorrow,

smile—and maybe tomorrow,

you’ll see the sun come shining through for you.1

一首歌是一个微型世界，可以引导我们走进更大的世界。英格玛·伯格曼的电影《芬妮和亚历山大》（1982）中的角色奥斯卡很好地描述了这一点：“外面是大世界，有时小世界会暂时反映出大世界，让我们更好地理解它。”

A song is a miniature world that can guide us in our own larger world. The character Oscar in Ingmar Bergman’s movie Fanny and Alexander (1982) describes this well: “Outside is the big world, and sometimes the small world manages for a moment to reflect the big world so that we understand it better.”

所以我充满希望。我们需要点燃理性的火焰——并努力做到这一点，无论是在政治上，还是在个人生活和信仰中。如果我们做对了，理性的火焰将继续燃烧——有时也许只是微弱的——但它永远不会熄灭。这就是我的信念。

So I am hopeful. We need to light the flame of reason—and work hard to do so as well as in politics as in our personal lives and beliefs. If we do things right, the flame of reason will keep on burning—sometimes perhaps only faintly—but it will never die. That is what I believe.

这本书是我一生的写作计划。它概括了我所信仰和想要捍卫的一切。我要感谢道格拉斯·霍夫施塔特 (Douglas Hofstadter) 在这个项目上的出色合作。在我二十岁时，您是我的思想英雄。如今，半生过去了，您已成为我非常亲密的朋友。甚至连哥德尔都猜不到这一点！感谢您的合作以及我们过去和未来所有极具思想启发性的对话。

This book project has been the writing project of my life. It summarizes everything I believe in and want to stand up for. I want to thank Douglas Hofstadter for a fantastic collaboration on this project. You were my intellectual hero when I was twenty years old. Now, a half life later, you have become a very dear friend. Not even Gödel would have guessed that! Thanks for the collaboration and all the extremely intellectually stimulating conversations we have had and will have in the future.

我还要感谢我的爱人和生活伴侣维多利亚·拉姆在整个项目中给予我的所有智力和情感支持。你奇特而美丽的才智，以及你对音乐、艺术和思想史的深入研究，对我的思考过程帮助很大。我们每天几乎要下十盘快棋，这让我精力充沛（尽管我很担心我的胜率正在缓慢但肯定地下降）。谢谢你，我的爱人，谢谢你所做的一切。

I also want to thank my love and life partner Victoria Larm for all her intellectual and emotional support throughout this project. Your strange and beautiful intellect, as well as your deep investigations into music, art, and the history of ideas have helped me so deeply in my thinking process. And all our games of blitz chess, almost ten a day, keep me on my feet (even though I’m quite worried that my percentage of wins is slowly but surely diminishing). Thank you, my love, for all this and everything else.

最后，我要感谢我的儿子列奥纳多（以中世纪意大利数学家列奥纳多·斐波那契命名），他赋予了我生命最深刻的存在意义。你现在还太小，读不了这本书，但我相信不久的将来你就会相信。我记得你一年级时放学回家时说：“爸爸，我大多数同学都说他们相信鬼！这太令人恼火了！我该怎么办？”理智的火焰已经点燃。它是如此美丽。

And finally, I want to thank my son Leonardo (named after the medieval Italian mathematician Leonardo Fibonacci) for giving my life the deepest of existential meaning. You are too young to read this book at the moment, but I am sure that you will do so in the near future. I remember when you came home from school in your first year and said “Daddy, most of my classmates says they believe in ghosts! It is so irritating! What can I do?” The flame of reason had already been lit. It was so beautiful.

斯德哥尔摩，2021 年 3 月

Stockholm, March 2021

克里斯特·史都马克

Christer Sturmark

笔记

NOTES

序言：Christer Sturmark

Foreword by Christer Sturmark

1.在此过程中，他通过一封温和的电子邮件，不仅纠正了我在瑞典语（我的母语）中犯下的一些事实错误，而且还纠正了一些语法错误！

1. And in one gentle e-mail during the process, he corrected not only some factual errors but also some grammatical errors I had made in Swedish—my mother tongue!

2. “世俗”一词最初来自拉丁语saecularis，意为“世俗的”，与“教会的”相对，后者意为“教会的”。

2. The term “secular” comes originally from the Latin word saecularis, meaning “worldly,” as opposed to “ecclesiastic,” meaning “churchly.”

序幕

Prelude

1.斯蒂芬·茨威格，《昨日的世界》（林肯：内布拉斯加大学出版社，1964 年）。

1. Stefan Zweig, The World of Yesterday (Lincoln: University of Nebraska Press, 1964).

2.茨威格，《昨日的世界》。

2. Zweig, The World of Yesterday.

3.体外受精技术的发明者罗伯特·爱德华兹于2010年获得诺贝尔医学奖，此举引发天主教会等组织的强烈抗议。

3. The inventor of in vitro fertilization, Robert G. Edwards, was awarded the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 2010, which led to vehement protests from the Catholic Church, among others.

第一章 以开放的心态面对世界

Chapter One. To Meet the World with an Open Mind

1 . Pierre-Marc-Gaston, duc de Lévis, Maximes et réflexions sur différents sujets demorale et de politique (巴黎，1808)。

1. Pierre-Marc-Gaston, duc de Lévis, Maximes et réflexions sur différents sujets de morale et de politique (Paris, 1808).

2.卡罗尔，本名查尔斯·路特维奇·道奇森，是一位英国作家、数学家、逻辑学家和摄影师。他于 1865 年创作的充满奇幻色彩的书籍《爱丽丝梦游仙境》和七年后创作的《爱丽丝镜中奇遇记》使他名垂青史。

2. Carroll, whose real name was Charles Lutwidge Dodgson, was an English writer, mathematician, logician, and photographer. His fantasy-filled books Alice in Wonderland, written in 1865, and Alice through the Looking-Glass, written seven years later, made him immortal.

3.《1950年诺贝尔文学奖》，诺贝尔奖，2021年8月16日访问，https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1950/summary/。

3. “The Nobel Prize in Literature 1950,” Nobel Prize, accessed August 16, 2021, https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1950/summary/.

4.雷蒙德·斯穆里安（1919–2017）是美国数学家、魔术师、钢琴演奏家、逻辑学家、道教徒和哲学家。

4. Raymond Smullyan (1919–2017) was an American mathematician, magician, concert pianist, logician, Taoist, and philosopher.

5.我所说的“书呆子气太重”可以通过你对以下说法的反应来衡量：“世界上有十​​种人：一种人可以用二进制计数，另一种人不能。”如果你笑了，那你肯定是个书呆子。

5. What I mean by “going overboard in nerdity” can be measured by your reaction to the following statement: “There are ten types of people in the world: those who can count in binary, and those who can’t.” If you laughed, you’re a definite nerd.

6.例如，请参阅迈克尔·舍默（Michael Shermer）1997 年出版的《人们为何相信奇怪的事情》（纽约：弗里曼出版社）一书，其中有关于冷读、模式识别、统计诡计等问题的讨论。

6. See, for example, Michael Shermer’s 1997 book Why People Believe in Weird Things (New York: Freeman) for a discussion of cold reading, pattern recognition, statistical trickery, and so forth.

7 . 奥卡姆的威廉（1285-1349）毕业于牛津大学，是一位英国神学家、哲学家，也是一位方济会修士。他的“剃刀”代表了这样一种观点：过于复杂的事物解释应该“剃掉”。

7. William of Ockham (1285–1349), educated at Oxford University, was an English theologian and philosopher, as well as a Franciscan monk. His “razor” represents the idea that overly complex explanations of things should be “shaved away.”

8.柏拉图的《申辩》、《克里托篇》和苏格拉底的《斐多篇》（约公元前 399 年）。

8. Plato, Apology, Crito and Phaedo of Socrates (ca. 399 BCE).

9.弗朗西斯·培根，《名言：值得引用的名言》，Goodreads，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://www.goodreads.com/quotes/1376291-for-the-mind-of-man-is-far-from-the-nature。

9. Francis Bacon, “Quotes: Quotable Quotes,” Goodreads, accessed August 16, 2021, https://www.goodreads.com/quotes/1376291-for-the-mind-of-man-is-far-from-the-nature.

10 . 译者注：在瑞典语原文中，作者选择从不将“God”一词大写。这在当代瑞典语中是完全可以接受的。然而，在英语中，这样做是行不通的。例如，短语“In god we trust”看起来和句子“A book by christer sturmark was anglicized by douglas hofstadter”一样错误。如果我们在英语中做瑞典语中所做的，作者会给人留下对所有形式宗教的极度蔑视的印象，但他绝对不是。因此，我们选择了不同的政策——即，当“God”一词充当单数明确专有名词时，它要大写。然而，当名词以不定的方式使用，或复数形式使用时，使用小写g看起来没问题，所以这成为了我们的政策。在某些情况下，这需要判断，我们会尽最大努力。

10. Translator’s note: In the Swedish original, the author chose never to capitalize the word for “God.” This is quite acceptable in contemporary Swedish. However, in English, it wouldn’t work. For instance, the phrase “In god we trust” looks just as wrong as does the sentence “A book by christer sturmark was anglicized by douglas hofstadter.” If we were to do in English what was done in Swedish, the author would come across as being aggressively scornful of all forms of religion, which he is decidedly not. We therefore opted for a different policy—namely, the word “God” is capitalized whenever it is acting as a singular definite proper noun. However, when the noun is used in an indefinite way, or is pluralized, then using a lowercase g looks fine, so that became our policy. In some cases, it required a judgment call, and we used our best judgment.

11 . “Livsåskådning”，Uppslagsverket，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://www.ne.se/uppslagsverk/encyklopedi/l%C3%A5ng/livs%C3%A5sk%C3%A5dning。

11. “Livsåskådning,” Uppslagsverket, accessed August 16, 2021, https://www.ne.se/uppslagsverk/encyklopedi/l%C3%A5ng/livs%C3%A5sk%C3%A5dning.

12.梵语“theravada”的意思是“最古老的学派”。这种佛教的原始形式今天广泛存在于斯里兰卡、缅甸、泰国、老挝、柬埔寨和越南。

12. The Sanskrit word “theravada” means “the oldest school.” This original form of Buddhism is widely found today in Sri Lanka, Burma, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, and Vietnam.

13.有关世俗人文主义的更多信息，请参阅菲利普·基切尔 (Philip Kitcher) 的《信仰之后的生活：世俗人文主义的案例》 (康涅狄格州纽黑文：耶鲁大学出版社，2014 年) 或斯蒂芬·劳 (Stephen Law) 的《人文主义：非常简短的介绍》 (英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2011 年)。

13. For more information on secular humanism, see, for example, Philip Kitcher’s book Life after Faith: The Case for Secular Humanism (New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2014) or Stephen Law’s book Humanism: A Very Short Introduction (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2011).

第二章 我相信我知道

Chapter Two. I Believe That I Know

1.参见尤金·维格纳，《数学在描述自然科学方面的不合理有效性》，《纯粹与应用数学通讯》第 13 卷第 1 期（1960 年 2 月）；马克斯·泰格马克，《我们的数学宇宙》（纽约：企鹅出版社，2015 年）。

1. See Eugene Wigner, “The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics in Describing the Natural Sciences,” Communications in Pure and Applied Mathematics 13, no. 1 (February 1960); Max Tegmark, Our Mathematical Universe (New York: Penguin, 2015).

2.伯特兰·罗素，《物质的分析》（纽约：Harcourt Brace，1927），第201页。

2. Bertrand Russell, The Analysis of Matter (New York: Harcourt Brace, 1927), 201.

3.亚里士多德，《形而上学》，引自 Marian David 所著《真理的对应性》，《斯坦福哲学百科全书》 ，最后更新于 2015 年 5 月 28 日，https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/truth-correspondence/#1。

3. Aristotle, Metaphysics, quoted in Marian David, “The Correspondence of Truth,” in Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, last updated May 28, 2015, https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/truth-correspondence/#1.

4.有关量子力学奥秘的详细介绍，请参阅 Nicolas Gisin 的《量子机会：非局域性、隐形传态和其他量子奇迹》（纽约：Springer，2014 年）。

4. For a good introduction to the mysteries of quantum mechanics, see Nicolas Gisin, Quantum Chance: Nonlocality, Teleportation, and Other Quantum Marvels (New York: Springer, 2014).

5.罗伯特·布兰登 (Robert Brandom) 的《罗蒂及其批评家》 (马萨诸塞州马尔登：布莱克威尔，2000 年)对罗蒂的思想进行了很好的介绍。

5. A good introduction to Rorty’s ideas is given in Robert Brandom, Rorty and His Critics (Malden, MA: Blackwell, 2000).

6.参见保罗·博格西安，《对知识的恐惧：反对相对主义和建构主义》（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2006年）。

6. See Paul Boghossian, Fear of Knowledge: Against Relativism and Constructivism (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2006).

7.参见布鲁诺·拉图尔，《潘多拉的希望：科学研究的现实性论》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1999 年）。

7. See Bruno Latour, Pandora’s Hope: An Essay on the Reality of Science Studies (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1999).

8.参见 Ophelia Benson 和 Jeremy Stangroom合著《为什么真相很重要》（纽约：Continuum，2006 年）。

8. See Ophelia Benson and Jeremy Stangroom, Why Truth Matters (New York: Continuum, 2006).

9.今天，我们认识到李先科的一些想法并没有错。所谓的表观遗传学研究表明，环境对遗传的影响实际上比人们想象的要大。

9. Today, we realize that some of Lysenko’s ideas were not wrong. The study of what is called epigenetics shows that the environment can in fact exert a greater influence on what is inherited than had been thought.

10.有关社会建构主义的批判性考察，请参阅哲学家伊恩·哈金 (Ian Hacking) 所著的《什么的社会建构？》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1999 年）。

10. For a critical examination of social constructivism, see the book by philosopher Ian Hacking titled The Social Construction of What? (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1999).

11、后现代主义是一个很宽泛的概念，其含义有多种解释，典型的一种是认为只有主观的、个人的真理才存在，任何相信通过科学、技术和理性的进步来解放人类的信念都应被抛弃。

11. Postmodernism is a very broad notion, and there are many interpretations of its meaning. A typical one is that there exist only subjective and personal truths, and that any belief in humanity’s liberation through progress in science, technology, and rationality should be abandoned.

12.艾伦·索卡尔 (Alan Sokal) 在《超越骗局》 (Beyond the Hoax)（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2009 年）一书中对这一著名事件及其后果进行了精彩的讨论。

12. An excellent discussion of this famous affair and its aftermath is given by Alan Sokal, Beyond the Hoax (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2009).

13 .参见 Moira von Wright，Genus och 文本：När kan man tala om jämställdhet i fysikläromedel？ [性别与文本：什么时候可以在物理教材中谈论平等？]（斯德哥尔摩：Skolverket，1999），24。

13. See Moira von Wright, Genus och text: När kan man tala om jämställdhet i fysikläromedel? [Gender and text: When can one speak of equality in physics teaching materials?] (Stockholm: Skolverket, 1999), 24.

14 .冯·赖特，属 och 文本，64。

14. von Wright, Genus och text, 64.

15 .冯·赖特，属 och 文本，65。

15. von Wright, Genus och text, 65.

16 .冯·赖特，属 och 文本，65。

16. von Wright, Genus och text, 65.

第三章 基于充分理由的信念

Chapter Three. Beliefs Based on Good Reasons

1.数学中的证明是一种论证——一系列纯逻辑步骤——从第一原理（公理）开始，遵循严格的形式规则（推理规则），最后得出最终结论（定理）。

1. A proof in mathematics is an argument—a sequence of purely logical steps—that starts from first principles (axioms), that follows strict formal rules (rules of inference), and that winds up in a final conclusion (a theorem).

2.但据我所知，还没有一位神学家能够真正解释这种所谓的依赖性究竟是如何产生的。

2. As far as I know, however, no theologian has actually managed to explain how this alleged dependence actually comes about.

3 .皮埃尔-西蒙·拉普拉斯，《概率分析理论》（巴黎，1812 年）；大卫·休谟（David Hume），《论奇迹》，载于《人类理解的探究》（1748 年）。

3. Pierre-Simon Laplace, Théorie analytique des probabilités (Paris, 1812); David Hume, “Of Miracles,” in An Enquiry concerning Human Understanding (1748).

4 .此示例改编自 Sören Holst、Tankar som ändrar allt [改变一切的想法] 的书（斯德哥尔摩：Fri Tanke，2012 年）。

4. This example is adapted from the book by Sören Holst, Tankar som ändrar allt [Thoughts that change everything] (Stockholm: Fri Tanke, 2012).

5.如前所述，伽利略声称《圣经》中关于自然的某些陈述不正确，这最终与天主教会发生了激烈冲突。他说，其中之一就是太阳周期性地绕地球旋转，而不是他自己所相信的地球绕太阳旋转。

5. As we saw earlier, Galileo wound up in a sharp clash with the Catholic Church when he claimed that certain statements about nature in the Bible were not true. One of these, he said, was the claim that the sun periodically circles the earth, rather than the other way around, which is what he himself believed.

第四章 什么是科学？

Chapter Four. What Is Science?

1. 2014 年，诺贝尔医学奖授予了揭示大脑如何追踪我们在房间中的位置的发现。英国研究人员 John O'Keefe 和挪威研究人员 May-Britt Moser 和 Edvard Moser 发现了大脑中的新细胞类型负责一个人对世界的方向感的细胞——即海马体中的所谓“位置细胞”和内嗅皮层中的“网格细胞”。

1. In 2014, the Nobel Prize in Medicine was awarded for discoveries that reveal how our brains keep track of where we are in a room. Researchers John O’Keefe, in England, and May-Britt Moser and Edvard Moser, in Norway, discovered new types of cells in the brain that are responsible for a person’s sense of orientation in the world—namely, so-called “place cells” in the hippocampus and “grid cells” in the entorhinal cortex.

2.例如，请参阅 Nils J. Nilsson 著《理解信仰》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，2014 年）。

2. See, for instance, Nils J. Nilsson, Understanding Beliefs (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2014).

3.阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦，《玻恩-爱因斯坦书信》，记录了阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦与马克斯·玻恩和海德薇格·玻恩在 1916 年至 1955 年间的书信往来，艾琳·玻恩译（伦敦：麦克米伦，1971 年）。

3. Albert Einstein, The Born-Einstein Letters, Correspondence between Albert Einstein and Max and Hedwig Born from 1916 to 1955, trans. Irene Born (London: Macmillan, 1971).

4.弦理论，前面曾简要提到过，是一种非常抽象的数学尝试，旨在描述物质最微小的组成部分；到目前为止，它还没有得到任何经验证实。尽管如此，仍有许多研究人员认为它前景光明。只有时间才能证明它是否真的站得住脚。

4. String theory, briefly alluded to earlier, is a very abstract mathematical attempt to describe the tiniest building blocks of matter; as of yet, it has no empirical confirmation whatsoever. Nonetheless, there are many researchers who consider it to be highly promising. Only time will tell if it actually holds up.

5.卡尔·波普尔，《无止境的探索：一部知识分子自传》（纽约：劳特利奇，1976年）。

5. Karl Popper, Unended Quest: An Intellectual Autobiography (New York: Routledge, 1976).

6.参见尼尔森的《理解信仰》。

6. See Nilsson, Understanding Beliefs.

7.波普尔，《无尽的探索》。（斜体为原文所加。）

7. Popper, Unended Quest. (Italics in the original.)

第五章 头脑里的幽灵

Chapter Five. Ghosts in the Head

1.丹尼尔·卡尼曼，1934 年出生，现为普林斯顿大学名誉教授，因“将心理学研究的见解融入经济学，特别是关于人类在不确定情况下的判断和决策”而获得 2002 年诺贝尔经济学奖。“丹尼尔·卡尼曼事实”，诺贝尔奖，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2002/kahneman/facts/。

1. Daniel Kahneman, born in 1934 and now a professor emeritus at Princeton University, received the 2002 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences “for having integrated insights from psychological research into economic science, especially concerning human judgment and decision-making under uncertainty” “Daniel Kahneman Facts,” Nobel Prize, accessed August 16, 2021, https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2002/kahneman/facts/.

2.请参阅 Daniel Kahneman 和 Amos Tversky，《不确定性下的判断》，《科学》 185 卷，第 4157 期（1974 年）：1124–1131 页。

2. See Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky, “Judgment under Uncertainty,” Science 185, no. 4157 (1974): 1124–31.

3.请参阅 Nicholas Epley 和 Erin Whitchurch，《魔镜魔镜：自我认知的增强》，《人格与社会心理学通讯》第 34 卷第 9 期（2008 年）：1159–170 页。

3. See Nicholas Epley and Erin Whitchurch, “Mirror, Mirror on the Wall: Enhancement in Self-Recognition,” Personality and Social Psychology Bulletin 34, no. 9 (2008): 1159–70.

4.请参阅我网站上的视频：“猴子生意幻觉”，Sturmark，2021 年 8 月 1 日访问，https://www.sturmark.se/bollspel。

4. See the video at my website: “The Monkey Business Illusion,” Sturmark, accessed August 1, 2021, https://www.sturmark.se/bollspel.

5.答案可以在这里找到：“Zombieviruset”，Sturmark，2021 年 8 月 1 日访问，https://www.sturmark.se/zombievirus。

5. The answer can be found here: “Zombieviruset,” Sturmark, accessed August 1, 2021, https://www.sturmark.se/zombievirus.

6.如果您和大多数读者一样，觉得这毫无意义，那么我邀请您查看此处的解释：“Mysteriet med de tre dörrarna”，Sturmark，2021 年 8 月 1 日访问，https://www.sturmark.se/tredorrar。

6. If you feel that this is nonsense, as most readers do, then I invite you to check out the explanation here: “Mysteriet med de tre dörrarna,” Sturmark, accessed August 1, 2021, https://www.sturmark.se/tredorrar.

7. Raymond Smullyan, The Chess Mysteries of Sherlock Holmes (New York: Knopf, 1979).

8.斯穆里安，《国际象棋之谜》。

8. Smullyan, The Chess Mysteries.

9. Smullyan，《国际象棋之谜》。

9. Smullyan, The Chess Mysteries.

10. Smullyan，《国际象棋之谜》。

10. Smullyan, The Chess Mysteries.

11. For those readers who simply want to see the puzzle’s answer, it can be found here: “Kortkontroll,” Sturmark, accessed August 1, 2021, https://www.sturmark.se/kortspel.

12. The answer to the second riddle can be found here: https://www.sturmark.se/krogen.

14. The answer can be found here: “Vem föreställer porträttet?” Sturmark, accessed August 1, 2021, https://www.sturmark.se/vem.

15.参见丹尼尔·丹尼特，《打破魔咒：作为一种自然现象的宗教》（纽约：维京出版社，2006年）。

15. See Daniel Dennett, Breaking the Spell: Religion as a Natural Phenomenon (New York: Viking, 2006).

16.例如，请参阅 Todd Tremlin 著《思想与神：宗教的认知基础》（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2010 年）。

16. See, for example, Todd Tremlin, Minds and Gods: The Cognitive Foundations of Religion (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2010).

17. Itzhak Fried、Charles L. Wilson、Katherine A. MacDonald 和 Eric J. Behnke，《电流刺激笑声》，《自然》 391 卷，第 6668 期（1998 年）：650，www.researchgate.net/ publication/13742090_Electric_current_stimulates_laughter 。

17. Itzhak Fried, Charles L. Wilson, Katherine A. MacDonald, and Eric J. Behnke, “Electric Current Stimulates Laughter,” Nature 391, no. 6668 (1998): 650, www.researchgate.net/publication/13742090_Electric_current_stimulates_laughter.

18.贾斯汀·巴雷特，《天生信徒：儿童宗教信仰的科学》（纽约：Atria Books，2012 年）。

18. Justin Barrett, Born Believers: The Science of Children’s Religious Belief (New York: Atria Books, 2012).

19.就我们的目的而言，代理可以被认为是具有目标或意图的事物，换句话说，是有意识的实体。我们自然倾向于区分单纯的物体（例如石头、木棍和炉子）和代理（例如人、动物，甚至可能是外星人和/或神）。

19. For our purposes, an agent can be thought of as something that has goals or intentions, in other words, a conscious entity. We tend naturally to distinguish between mere objects, such as stones, sticks, and stoves, and agents, such as people, animals, and possibly alien beings and/or gods.

20 . Barrett，《天生的信徒》。请参阅 Stephen Law 的《相信胡说八道：如何避免陷入智力黑洞》（马里兰州拉纳姆：普罗米修斯出版社，2011 年），其中对代理检测进行了详细解释。

20. Barrett, Born Believers. See Stephen Law, Believing Bullshit: How Not to Get Sucked into an Intellectual Black Hole (Lanham, MD: Prometheus, 2011), in which agent detection is explained in considerable detail.

21 . 保罗·布鲁姆，《上帝是个意外吗？》大西洋月刊，2005 年 12 月。

21. Paul Bloom, “Is God an Accident?” Atlantic Monthly, December 2005.

第六章 自然世界

Chapter Six. A Natural World

1.质数是只能被其本身和 1 整除的整数；例如 2、3、7、37 和 2011。相比之下，111 是 3 和 37 的乘积，不是质数。

1. A prime number is a whole number divisible only by itself and 1; a few examples are 2, 3, 7, 37, and 2011. By contrast, 111, being the product of 3 and 37, is not prime.

2.德怀特·D·艾森豪威尔，《总统签署将‘上帝保佑’一词纳入对国旗宣誓的法案时的声明》，美国总统计划，1954 年 6 月 14 日，https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/documents/statement-the-president-upon-signing-bill-include-the-words-under-god-the-pledge-the-flag。

2. Dwight D. Eisenhower, “Statement by the President upon Signing the Bill to Include the Words ‘under God’ in the Pledge to the Flag,” American Presidency Project, June 14, 1954, https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/documents/statement-the-president-upon-signing-bill-include-the-words-under-god-the-pledge-the-flag.

3. Jeffrey M. Jones，“无神论者和穆斯林认为总统候选人最具偏见”，盖洛普，2012 年 6 月 12 日，https://news.gallup.com/poll/155285/atheists-muslims-bias-presidential-candidates-aspx。

3. Jeffrey M. Jones, “Atheists, Muslims See Most Bias as Presidential Candidates,” Gallup, June 12, 2012, https://news.gallup.com/poll/155285/atheists-muslims-bias-presidential-candidates-aspx.

4. Miles Godfrey，《英国圣公会大主教 Peter Jensen 称无神论者是憎恨上帝的信徒》，News.com.au，2010 年 4 月 2 日，https://www.news.com.au/breaking-news/atheists-are-believers-who-hate-god-says-anglican-archbishop-peter-jensen/news-story/eae5d2eb21cc5c5d46cacf1cd01a1eb4。

4. Miles Godfrey, “Atheists Are Believers Who Hate God, Says Anglican Archbishop Peter Jensen,” News.com.au, April 2, 2010, https://www.news.com.au/breaking-news/atheists-are-believers-who-hate-god-says-anglican-archbishop-peter-jensen/news-story/eae5d2eb21cc5c5d46cacf1cd01a1eb4.

5 .阿道夫·希特勒，《我的奋斗》（柏林：Franz Eher Nachfolger GmbH，1925 年）。不幸的是，这个标准的英文翻译相当糟糕，但希望你能明白。

5. Adolf Hitler, Mein Kampf (Berlin: Franz Eher Nachfolger GmbH, 1925). This standard English translation is unfortunately pretty atrocious, but hopefully you get the idea.

6希特勒，《我的奋斗》。再次为这部“经典”的糟糕翻译道歉。但也许糟糕的书就应该有糟糕的翻译。

6. Hitler, Mein Kampf. Sorry once again for the atrocious translation of this “classic.” But maybe atrocious books deserve atrocious translations.

7.马丁·加德纳，《以科学的名义进行的时尚与谬误》（纽约：多佛，1952 年）。

7. Martin Gardner, Fads and Fallacies in the Name of Science (New York: Dover, 1952).

第七章 无需上帝也能做好事

Chapter Seven. Being Good without Needing God

1.德里克·帕菲特（Derek Parfit）生于 1942 年，逝于 2017 年，曾任牛津大学哲学教授，被广泛尊崇为伟大的心灵哲学家。他最著名著作《理由与人》（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，1984 年）探讨了道德和人类身份的问题。

1. Derek Parfit, who was born in 1942 and died in 2017, was a professor of philosophy at Oxford University; he was widely respected as a great philosopher of mind. His most celebrated book, Reasons and Persons (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 1984), deals with questions of morality and human identity.

2.柏拉图，《游西弗伦》（公元前 389 年），互联网经典档案，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，http://classics.mit.edu/Plato/euthyfro.html。

2. Plato, Euthyphro (389 BCE), Internet Classics Archive, accessed August 16, 2021, http://classics.mit.edu/Plato/euthyfro.html.

3.柏拉图，《游叙弗伦》。

3. Plato, Euthyphro.

4.西蒙·布莱克本，《伦理学：非常简短的介绍》（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2001年）。

4. Simon Blackburn, Ethics: A Very Short Introduction (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2001).

5.对印度教徒来说，湿婆是神最重要的化身之一，而克洛诺斯和瑞亚的儿子宙斯则是古希腊众神中地位最高的。

5. For Hindus, Shiva is one of the most important incarnations of God, while Zeus, the son of Kronos and Rhea, was the highest of all the ancient Greek gods.

6.这有点像美国人关于枪支的那句话：“枪不杀人，人杀人。”只要把“枪”换成“宗教”就行了。

6. It’s a bit like the American sound bite about guns: “Guns don’t kill people; people kill people.” Just substitute “religions” for “guns.”

7.例如，请参阅荷兰动物行为学家弗兰斯·德瓦尔的著作《灵长类动物和哲学家：道德如何演变》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，2006 年）和《倭黑猩猩和无神论者：寻找灵长类动物中的人文主义》（纽约：诺顿出版社，2014 年）。

7. See, for example, Dutch ethologist Frans de Waal’s books Primates and Philosophers: How Morality Evolved (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2006) and The Bonobo and the Atheist: In Search of Humanism among the Primates (New York: Norton, 2014).

8.道格拉斯·霍夫施塔特，《我们如何生活在彼此之中》，摘自《我是一个奇怪的循环》（纽约：Basic Books，2007 年）。

8. Douglas Hofstadter, “How We Live in Each Other,” in I Am a Strange Loop (New York: Basic Books, 2007).

第八章 新纪元信仰与理性危机

Chapter Eight. New Age Beliefs and the Crisis of Reason

1.请参阅《怀疑论者》杂志，网址：https://csicop.org/si。

1. See the journal Skeptical Inquirer at https://csicop.org/si.

2.参见 Scott O. Lilienfeld、Steven Jay Lynn、John Ruscio 和 Barry L. Beyerstein 合著的《大众心理学的五十大神话》（纽约：Wiley-Blackwell，2009 年）。

2. See Scott O. Lilienfeld, Steven Jay Lynn, John Ruscio, and Barry L. Beyerstein, Fifty Great Myths of Popular Psychology (New York: Wiley-Blackwell, 2009).

3.金字塔式销售计划，也称为“多层次营销”，是一种臭名昭著的欺诈性销售和营销方法，即招募卖家并指示他们销售公司的产品，同时他们还会招募更多的卖家。

3. Pyramidal sales schemes, also known as “multilevel marketing,” are a notorious fraudulent method of selling and marketing, whereby sellers are recruited and are instructed to sell the company’s products at the same time as they are also recruiting further sellers.

4. “印度占星术的印度测试”，《怀疑论者》第 37 卷，第 2 期（2013 年 3 月/4 月），https://skepticalinquirer.org/2013/03/an-indian-test-of-indian-astrology/。

4. “An Indian Test of Indian Astrology,” Skeptical Inquirer 37, no. 2 (March/April 2013), https://skepticalinquirer.org/2013/03/an-indian-test-of-indian-astrology/.

5.参阅 Roger B. Culver 和 Philip A. Ianna 合著的《占星术：真还是假？》（马里兰州拉纳姆：普罗米修斯出版社，1988 年）。

5. See Roger B. Culver and Philip A. Ianna, Astrology: True or False? (Lanham, MD: Prometheus, 1988).

6.请参阅《文化与宇宙：占星术和天文学史杂志》，网址：https://www.cultureandcosmos.org。

6. See Culture and Cosmos: A Journal of the History of Astrology and Astronomy at https://www.cultureandcosmos.org.

7.例如，请参阅 David J. Pittenger 的《衡量 MBTI……以及不足之处》，2021 年 7 月 29 日访问，https://jobtalk.indiana.edu/Articles/develop/mbti.pdf。

7. See, for example, David J. Pittenger, “Measuring the MBTI . . . and Coming up Short,” accessed July 29, 2021, https://jobtalk.indiana.edu/Articles/develop/mbti.pdf.

8 .例如，参见 Lennart Sjöberg，“En kritisk discussion av Myers-Briggs testet”[Myers-Briggs 测试的批判性讨论]，DocPlayer，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://docplayer.se/13823035-En-kritisk-diskussion-av-myers-briggs-testet.html。

8. See, for example, Lennart Sjöberg, “En kritisk diskussion av Myers-Briggs testet” [A critical discussion of the Myers-Briggs test], DocPlayer, accessed August 16, 2021, https://docplayer.se/13823035-En-kritisk-diskussion-av-myers-briggs-testet.html.

9.作为我对这个主题的研究的一部分，我请了一位 MBTI 顾问对我的性格进行测试。在我们讨论测试时，她发现我持怀疑态度，并试图反驳我的立场，说我只是具有怀疑的性格类型。她似乎从未想到，我的怀疑态度可能源于对某些事情持怀疑态度。

9. As part of my research on this topic, I had an MBTI consultant test my personality. While we were discussing the test, she detected that I was skeptical, and she tried to counter my stance by saying that I simply had a skeptical personality type. It never seemed to cross her mind that my skepticism might be rooted in the fact that there was something to be skeptical about.

第九章 当宗教脱离正轨时

Chapter Nine. When Religion Runs off the Rails

第十章 关于我们起源的争论

Chapter Ten. The Battle over Our Origins

1.斯蒂芬·杰伊·古尔德，《我已登陆：自然历史开端的结束》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：贝尔纳普出版社，2011 年）。

8. Bryan Austin 和 Christian Cotz，《最神圣的财产》，第一修正案博物馆，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://firstamendmentmuseum.org/the-most-sacred-property/。

8. Bryan Austin and Christian Cotz, “The Most Sacred Property,” First Amendment Museum, accessed August 16, 2021, https://firstamendmentmuseum.org/the-most-sacred-property/.

9. “Tennessee Evolution Statutes, Public Acts of the State of Tennessee,” University of Missouri–Kansas City, accessed September 3, 2021, http://law2.umkc.edu/faculty/projects/ftrials/scopes/tennstat.htm.

10.埃珀森诉阿肯色州案，393 US 97 (1968) 。

10. Epperson v. Arkansas, 393 U.S. 97 (1968).

11. “Programs”，探索研究所，2021 年 7 月 30 日访问，https://www.discovery.org/about/programs。

11. “Programs,” Discovery Institute, accessed July 30, 2021, https://www.discovery.org/about/programs.

12 .如果您能阅读瑞典语，您可能希望查看这篇报纸文章：“Bläckfiskens ögen en gåta”，Dagens Nyheter，2007 年 4 月 8 日，www.dn.se/ nyheter/vetenskap/blackfiskens-ogon-en-gata 。

12. If you can read Swedish, you might wish to check out this newspaper article: “Bläckfiskens ögen en gåta,” Dagens Nyheter, April 8, 2007, www.dn.se/nyheter/vetenskap/blackfiskens-ogon-en-gata.

13. Kitzmiller 等人诉多佛地区学区，400 F. Supp. 2d 707 (MD Pa. 2005) 。

13. Kitzmiller et al. v. Dover Area School District, 400 F. Supp. 2d 707 (M.D. Pa. 2005).

14.关于这个主题的一个有用的网站是国家科学教育中心（网站），2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://ncse.ngo/association-science-education。

14. A helpful website on this topic is National Center for Science Education (website), accessed August 16, 2021, https://ncse.ngo/association-science-education.

15. “楔子战略”，维基百科，最后更新于 2021 年 8 月 12 日，https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedge_strategy。

15. “Wedge Strategy,” Wikipedia, last updated August 12, 2021, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedge_strategy.

16.例如，Pingstkyrkan 是一座福音派基督教教堂，与被称为瑞典教会的路德教派截然不同，后者在四个世纪以来一直是瑞典的国教，尽管自 2000 年 1 月 1 日起，情况不再如此。

16. Pingstkyrkan, for example, is an evangelical Christian church distinct from the brand of Lutheranism known as the Church of Sweden, which for four centuries was Sweden’s state church, although as of January 1, 2000, that was no longer the case.

17 . “Allmän info om museet”，Den Förhistoriska Världen，2021 年 8 月 16 日访问，https://www.dinosaurier.nu/om-museet/allman-info-om-museet/。

17. “Allmän info om museet,” Den Förhistoriska Världen, accessed August 16, 2021, https://www.dinosaurier.nu/om-museet/allman-info-om-museet/.

18.请参阅斯凡特·帕博 (Svante Pääbo) 著作，《尼安德特人：寻找失落的基因》（纽约：Basic Books，2014 年）。

18. See Svante Pääbo’s book, Neanderthal Man: In Search of Lost Genes (New York: Basic Books, 2014).

第十一章 思想史

Chapter Eleven. The History of Ideas

1. Frans de Waal，《灵长类动物和哲学家：道德如何演变》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，2009 年）。

1. Frans de Waal, Primates and Philosophers: How Morality Evolved (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2009).

2.参见Stephen Law，《人文主义：非常简短的介绍》（英国牛津：牛津大学出版社，2011年）。

2. See Stephen Law, Humanism: A Very Short Introduction (Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press, 2011).

3.摘自《论语》（15、23）。孔子的这些思想集锦由他的弟子在公元前 400 年左右写下。

3. Taken from The Analects of Confucius (15, 23). These collections of Confucius’s ideas were written down by his disciples around 400 BCE.

4 .比尔吉塔·福斯曼，《无神道德》，译。道格拉斯·霍夫施塔特（Douglas Hofstadter）（斯德哥尔摩：Fri Tanke，2011）。

4. Birgitta Forsman, Godless Morality, trans. Douglas Hofstadter (Stockholm: Fri Tanke, 2011).

5.阿威罗伊的实际名字是“阿布·瓦利德·穆罕默德·伊本·艾哈迈德·伊本·鲁世德”，他的第一本书是关于医学的；然而，他最大的贡献是在哲学方面。

5. Averroës was actually named “Abū l-Walīd Muḥammad Ibn ’Aḥmad Ibn Rushd,” and his first book dealt with medicine; however, his greatest contributions were made in philosophy.

6、法律、人文主义。

6. Law, Humanism.

7 . 在发表这番挑衅性言论约十五年后，拉辛格枢机主教当选为教皇，并因此采用了“本笃十六世”这一名称。

7. Some fifteen years after making this provocative statement, Cardinal Ratzinger was elected pope, and as such he adopted the name “Benedict XVI.”

8 .请参阅雅克·阿塔利 (Jacques Attali) 的传记《狄德罗，ou Le bonheur de penser》（巴黎：Pluriel，2013 年）。

8. See Jacques Attali’s biography Diderot, ou Le bonheur de penser (Paris: Pluriel, 2013).

9 .伏尔泰，Traité sur la tolérance [关于宽容的论文] (1763)。

9. Voltaire, Traité sur la tolérance [A treatise on tolerance] (1763).

10 .伊曼纽尔·康德，《Beantwortung der Frage：它是启蒙吗？》 [问题的答案：什么是启蒙？]（1784）。

10. Immanuel Kant, “Beantwortung der Frage: Was ist die Aufklärung?” [An answer to the question: What is enlightenment?] (1784).

11.杰里米·边沁，《道德与立法原则导论》（1789年）。

11. Jeremy Bentham, An Introduction to the Principles of Morals and Legislation (1789).

12.托马斯·潘恩，《理性时代》（1793年）。

12. Thomas Paine, The Age of Reason (1793).

13.参见苏珊·雅各比（Susan Jacoby）著《自由思想者：美国世俗主义史》（纽约：Metropolitan/Owl，2005年）。

13. See Susan Jacoby, Freethinkers: A History of American Secularism (New York: Metropolitan/Owl, 2005).

14. Vivian Green, A New History of Christianity (London: A. & C. Black, 2000).

后记与致谢

Afterword and Words of Thanks

1.我的好朋友、爵士歌手 Isabella Lundgren 录制了一张完美的专辑，里面的歌曲可以帮助我们达到这种精神状态。请参阅https://www.isabellalundgren.com/。

1. A perfect album of songs helping us reach this state of mind has been recorded by my good friend, jazz singer Isabella Lundgren. See https://www.isabellalundgren.com/.
